source.8899b431:
df = pd.read_excel("../input/ab-testing/ab_testing.xlsx", sheet_name = "Control Group")
df.drop(['Unnamed: 4','Unnamed: 5', 'Unnamed: 6', 'Unnamed: 7', 'Unnamed: 8', 'Unnamed: 9','Unnamed: 10', 'Unnamed: 11', 'Unnamed: 12', 'Unnamed: 13'],axis='columns', inplace=True)
df2 = pd.read_excel("../input/ab-testing/ab_testing.xlsx", sheet_name= "Test Group")
df2.drop(['Unnamed: 4','Unnamed: 5', 'Unnamed: 6', 'Unnamed: 7', 'Unnamed: 8', 'Unnamed: 9','Unnamed: 10', 'Unnamed: 11', 'Unnamed: 12', 'Unnamed: 13'],axis='columns', inplace=True)
source.a8944ba8:
test_stat, pvalue = shapiro(df["Purchase"])
print('Test Stat = %.4f, p-value = %.4f' % (test_stat, pvalue))
source.69e158a0:
test_stat, pvalue = shapiro(df2["Purchase"])
print('Test Stat = %.4f, p-value = %.4f' % (test_stat, pvalue))
source.4fb51cdc:
test_stat, pvalue = levene(df["Purchase"], df2["Purchase"])
print('Test Stat = %.4f, p-value = %.4f' % (test_stat, pvalue))
source.2ed9119b:
test_stat, pvalue = ttest_ind(df["Purchase"], df2["Purchase"], equal_var=True)
print('Test Stat = %.4f, p-value = %.4f' % (test_stat, pvalue))

source.77c7f4bf:
**A/B Testing**

HO : There is no statistically significant difference between the control group served with the max bid campaign and the test group served with the average bid campaign.

H1 : There is a statistically significant difference between the control group served with the max bid campaign and the test group served with the average bid campaign
source.b8e720ec: p value greater than 0.05, so HO can't be reject. There is no statistically significant difference between the data.
source.3806b84c: df and df2 values are close to each other. However, is there a statistically significant relationship?
